Name: Six Ideas That Shaped Physics: Unit R - Laws of Physics are Frame-Independent

ReviewList.Text: This is a very good intro to special relativity. The author uses spacetime diagrams very skillfuly and explains even confusing topics very clearly. Overall, a very good book.

Physic is amazing and this book proves it. Brought it for PHYS 344 course at Purdue University. Do not need to go to the class ever since. Pass all exams related to the topice accordingly. The book is not very thick, but well printed and is written in clear and consistent language. Bravo!

I am using these book in a physics class in college and while it is very helpful and good at explaining concepts, there are very few worked out problem which makes it very hard to apply the material. Also, the publisher will not give teachers permission to post the answers in the book so there is no way to check if you did the practice problems right. Overall I would not recommend this as the primary book for a physics course.

This book was required for a physics course I was taking in college. The text can be a bit verbose at times but overall the material is not too hard to understand for anyone who has a basic background in physics.

I had to buy this book for a modern physics course, it explains most of the basics for special relativity in a simple to understand and very graphic manner. However i did feel that the book was kind of basic, and that could have elaborated a bit more on the subject of general relativity. This book is probably better suited for a highschool AP course than a college course. But then again I'm probably too strict when judging course materials...

I am impressed by the quality of this used book. It is brand new but they labled it as "in very good condition" and sell it 50% cheaper than new ones. I think I will starting buying all textbooks from Amazon now.
I received the wrong copy of this Physics textbook. I received Unit: C instead of Unit R. This is unacceptable.
